channel.title: Strange Jarring Issue
channel.description: Right, every single source and client I've tried I've had this problem. The problem being that whenever I change the client.java's IP to my own, then compile, Jarring fails. Don't tell me I'm jarring wrong because I know I'm not because I've done it years ago on my old computer. Whenever I've changed the IP and then Jar it, it comes up with the error "Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit. Whereas if I don't change anything and I Jar it... It works. What is the problem with me changing my IP and compiling?

item.title: Strange Jarring Issue
item.dc:creator: @ProximityPlus ProximityPlus
item.description:
@ProximityPlus wrote:

Right, every single source and client I’ve tried I’ve had this problem. The problem being that whenever I change the client.java’s IP to my own, then compile, Jarring fails. Don’t tell me I’m jarring wrong because I know I’m not because I’ve done it years ago on my old computer. Whenever I’ve changed the IP and then Jar it, it comes up with the error "Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit. Whereas if I don’t change anything and I Jar it… It works. What is the problem with me changing my IP and compiling?

Read full topic
